item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "There is science, logic, reason; there is thought verified by experience. And then there is California." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "My own ambition, my deepest and truest ambition, is to find within myself someday, somehow, the ability to do likewise, to do NOTHING - and find it enough." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Whatever we cannot understand easily we call God; this saves wear and tear on the brain tissues." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "A giant thirst is a great joy when quenched in time." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Anarchism? You bet your sweet betsy. The only cure for the ills of democracy is more democracy. Much more." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Why can't we simply borrow what is useful to us from Buddhism, Hinduism, Taoism, especially Zen, as we borrow from Christianity, science, American Indian traditions and world literature in general, including philosophy, and let the rest go hang? Borrow what we need but rely principally upon our own senses, common sense and daily living experience." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "From the point of view of a tapeworm, man was created by God to serve the appetite of the tapeworm." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Saving the world is only a hobby. Most of the time I do nothing." -- Edward Abbey
